intro: Galianthe boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
